website_summaries.verdict: Good and affordable heating option for your chilly garage or workshop.
pros: Heats up to 600 square feet with Auto Overheat Cut-Off Protection
Heats up chilly garage to comfortable temperature quickly
cons: Only uses a 220V plug, not a standard outlet

customer_reviews.title: Can melt down and catch fire.
customer_reviews.text: Used this heater very little for about 4 years. Worked pretty good when I needed it. Well the other day it melted down and caught some things in my garage on fire. Lucikly I was able to put the fire out but it caused A LOT of damage. A fire inspector will be out Monday. It never tripped the breaker and just continued to melt down.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jones

customer_reviews.title: Little gem
customer_reviews.text: This little gem was delivered yesterday, plugged it in this morning and it’s been working the last six hours I cannot tell you how pleased I am. I only wish I had 220 outlets throughout the main house. I have a detached 500sq foot insulated garage/gym/shop and it heats the entire room up in minutes. The thermostat is doing a great job keeping the space at 64 degrees (my comfort zone) it could easily keep it warmer if I would like, outside temp is 38.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, continuous high heat source!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to super-heat a room and later an enclosed, insulated temp structure we built for some valuable furniture to get rid of bed-bugs. After we checked out the thou$ands they wanted for the 'kits' they sell, we realized the heart of the systems is a reliable source of continuous heat to raise the temp in a space high enough for long enough to penetrate every part of a room & the furnishings to kill all those nasty critters (check out Reddit, YouTube & blogs for minimum temp & time). Bedroom took 48 hrs - so this baby was worth EVERY PENNY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Best shop heater for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Best shop heater for the price, hands down. Looking at older reviews, it seems like they’ve fixed any prior consumer complaints. Works well right out of the box and not noisy at all. Seems to put out good heat for it’s consumption; didn’t seem to raise our electric bill much at all, maybe added $20 per month for each heater. Definitely beats any gas heater we’ve tried, especially in terms of cost of use. Using 2 of these in a non-insulated 1200 square foot, 14 foot tall metal shop with great results. We bought a 3rd one just in case and unless it dips down into the 20’s at night, the 3rd one is not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Classic Muscle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent utility heater.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for use in a 30x20 unheated basement and a 10x16 outbuilding/studio. In the winter time, the basement generally dosen't get much below 50 and this heater will heat it up to 70 in about 20mins. The outbuilding can get down to single digits and this heater will have it heated up in about 10mins. Requires a bit of an unusual plug, but it's available at any home improvement or electrical supply store and anybody with a rudimentary knowledge of residential electrical panels should be able to wire it. Requires a double-pole 20amp breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: So far, nice little heater.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant after reading some negative reviews, but took a chance anyway. I just tried it out today while mudding sheet rock. It warmed my 22x30 garage from 50 degreen to 65 degrees in around 10 minutes; outside temp. 48 degrees. The stat kicked on and off as it should as the temperature changed. So far I'm glad I made the purchase rather than the one that costs almost twice the price that I almost bought. The 6-30 plug is a bit of a hassle, but since I was wiring my garage at the time, adding a recepticle for it was not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Worker49

customer_reviews.title: Heater works well, one thing to prolong the life of your heater:
customer_reviews.text: It heated up a 20 degree garage pretty quick, the air isn't hot but warm and a good volume. If you want to make your heater last a long time, when shutting down, turn the fan switch to on instead of auto, then turn the heat knob off. The fan will continue to run and cool down the heating elements, instead of letting them overheat once the air flow is off. Once it cools down, then turn the fan back to auto.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: POS.  Blows out warm air.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good heater. I mounted it on my garage ceiling last year. Didn't get to use it until this year. The garage temperature was 24 degrees. After it runs for 3 hours, it was still 24 degrees in the garage. Save your money, buy a good propane heater.
customer_reviews.author: Quoc Tran

customer_reviews.title: Not a death trap
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I bought this hoping it would burn my house down. You know, for insurance purposes. I'm sad to report that it works quite well and is NOT the fire hazard the comments make it out to be.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna M

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: First one crapped out in about 6 months. Thermostat quit working. Second one is working well. I use it to heat the main living area in my home and it heats the area fast, about 700 square feet. also heats my garage in winter. will get it comfortable from freezing in a couple hours. Does not feel like the air is very hot coming out of the fan, but don't be fooled. Judge by the end result
customer_reviews.author: Soutthpaw

customer_reviews.title: Great option for garage heat
customer_reviews.text: This heater raised the temperature 15 degrees inside my garage in 30 minutes. You will need a special 220v plug, 30 amp breaker for this heater as it’s not your typical household type. Have a reliable electrician install it ($300) as this is not a do it yourself project. I had the electrician install a 25’ cord so that the heater would center in my garage, and throws out even heat. The heater is a little noisy but when involved with a project I won’t really notice. This heater will heat a 24’x28’ garage fairly quickly and I recommend this one. Truly a must if it’s your only alternative to baseboard, oil, or propane fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty worthless. At 10 months (perhaps 4 months of sporadic use) the fan started hitting the shroud and seized. Weak motor, low quality sheet metal work.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great heater for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great little heater. I already had 220 wiring in my barn and just needed to change plug. Heated a 38 degree non insulated 10x20 barn In south Alabama to comfortable level. My only complaint is that it doesn’t have a turn off switch on the heater itself. I have to turn it off at the breaker, but not really a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Shevie S.

customer_reviews.title: BIG HEAT!! Amazing BTU output on this one. May have to swap to different 220 Plug. Check it!
customer_reviews.text: man, it is a bit loud but boy does it put out the heat! I highly recommend this. Heats my Ma's living Room and kitchen (old uninsulated house) in no time! Look at the BTUs before you buy an electric heater! This one really has high BTUs compared to all the other units! You may have to change out your 220 plug to this one stated in the ad because it needs to pull that extra power for the increased heating it puts out. 220 plugs are based on how much power they have to give.
customer_reviews.author: Brandywine

customer_reviews.title: Nice heater
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how fast it works in my uninsulated oversize 3 car garage. If it's 30 outside, the garage will be 55 (where I like it) in less than 30 minutes. After that it's thermostat takes over and it really doesn't seem to need to cycle on and off much. It's not particularly noisy or quiet, but remember ita a large fan so you will hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: It didn't put out the full wattage. Based on clamp on current meter. Since the wattage was marginal for my space anyway I returned it once I realized it wasn't putting out the full amount.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Heat output, temperature control, noise level
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful heater. We will be getting another one of these as they put out such great heat, without making a lot of noise. The temperature control is a cinch to run. I’m always cold in the winter and this will help for one room that I’m in.
customer_reviews.author: Donna K. Groskopf

customer_reviews.title: I'm Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm Very happy with my purchase , the heater is lite weight and blows much more air then any heater I have ever owend it takes the chill out of the air pretty easy considering my shop isn't insolated at all and has a 14 ft ceiling and drafts from the "humps" in the corrugated metal roof,The only "Con" it has that I can see is it doesn't have a ON OFF switch. So I have to unplug it after each use because I worry it may turn on when I'm not out there and waste electricity.. BUY 2 plugs and install one in your home for emergency use if you main heater fails,I plan to order another plug myself.
customer_reviews.author: bew

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Heats my shop very well. Here is the data. Shop is 20x30, 10 ft ceiling. Insulated. Car door, man door, two 2ft by 4ft windows. At 1/4 turn of the dial, heats the shop to 62 degrees. Out side temp, high 37 F, low 19 F. Thermostat works great. When I check the heater, it is often off. So even at 1/4 turn, does not run full time to heat shop to 62. The back, sides, top, bottom cool to touch. The front is hot, but almost "touchable." Turned up full blast, too hot to work. The best heater I found to heat the shop. Buy it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: llp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heater
customer_reviews.text: I love this little heater. I just used it all winter to keep my little 330 sq/ft garage at room temperature. The internal thermostat works perfectly. The heater kicks on and off as needed, and I can step into the garage at any time and work in a comfortable environment. And our electric bill was still very reasonable while using this all winter. My only gripe is that it doesn't have an on/off switch. I would prefer a switch instead of needing to unplug it all the time to shut it off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year. Put it in my shop. The shop is only an oversized one car garage with an attic. The unit is a little noisy, but then it is in a shop. So it doesn’t really matter. It heats up fast. It does this in temps in the 20’s. It keeps my shop comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hoy

customer_reviews.title: This works good for how I'm using it
customer_reviews.text: This works good for how I'm using it. I have a 1000 sq ft insulated garage in eastern Idaho (IE:-20 degree winter) It is a slow heat because it is small for this size garage I have. It works great when the outside temp is above 25 degrees. I have to use secondary propane or I need a second electric heater when it is below 25 degrees. The surface doesn't get too hot to the touch. It is quieter than my 80,000 btu propane heater, and doesn't cover everything in condensation. If I use the propane heater to fast heat the garage, this heater will keep it warm all day.
customer_reviews.author: B.E. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Pretty imprerssive for the money...
customer_reviews.text: Using this unit (two of them) in a large aircraft hangar, only mildly insulated, about 3400 square floor feet and 20 ft peak in the roof... While in super cold nights, I have to boost hangar heast with a 125K BTU propane bullet heater, these two units still do a great job considering what I am asking them to do... ESPECIALLY for the cost of them. I could probably add two more and be fine.... These are very solidly built, reliable, and throw real heat. Not too noisy. Half the cost of a similar, but smaller unit which I tried from Home Depot, that cost twice these units. Quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Awesome heater
customer_reviews.text: This thing works GREAT. I use it to heat my office at work, I have a 220V line close enough, so I figured it would work better than those wooden infrared boxes that cost the same amount but are only 1500W each. The mechanical thermostat does a great job of regulating temperature, noise level is not too bad either (even in a quiet office). Louder than a 1500W ceramic heater, probably about the same noise level as the vornado type heaters with larger fan. Moves enough air so the area heats quickly and it is not any hotter in one area of my office than another. Outside case temperature stays cool.
customer_reviews.author: triphase

customer_reviews.title: QUIT AFTER THREE MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Three months after bought it stopped working. Call the manufacturer and they want me to change out the thermostat. However the directions say ,"PLEASE DO NOT ATTEMPT TO OPEN OR REPAIR THE HEATER YOURSELF. DOING SO COULD CAUSE DAMAGE OR PERSONAL INJURY. Amazing they are asking me to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Claude Minor Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great heater.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid little heater, I know some have complained about the noise and motor longevity, but overall, in a construction environment, this thing rocks, and seems pretty well made compared to some of the other units I've used. Heats an insulated two car garage from 15 to 60 degrees in a matter of a couple hours. I've used it for emergency temp heat inside jobsites, while the central heat has been down, and it easily maintains 60-65 degrees in the dead of a Minnesota winter.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a little leery about the size but when plugged it in about 15 minutes my work was 70 degrees while it was 30 outside. Very,very satisfied with this purchase. Money well spent. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: F 150 2005

customer_reviews.title: Very good heater works great
customer_reviews.text: It's a great heater and works to hear a 900 square foot building it's a little noisy but worth it the plug is a pain they need to make it a usual stove plug but I had to wire up a 3 prong 240 outlet for it but that was it works great
customer_reviews.author: A. Garland

customer_reviews.title: Great space heater for garage workshop
customer_reviews.text: Very well made heater. Does a great job warming up a workspace in a large garage. The unit gets hot, but not glowing red/burn stuff to the ground hot, which is nice in a garage. Very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: larryw

customer_reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED!! CAUTION!! Potential Fire Hazard.
customer_reviews.text: Fan motor failed in less than 30 hours total run time. Our unit is less than a year old. When fan motor failed, the unit DID NOT shut down. The heating element stayed on and defective motor unit completely seized and then began to overheat. If you still decide to take a chance with this product DO NOT LEAVE UNATTENDED. There was a registration card and operator's manual but there was no written warranty with this product.
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for the $100 deal
customer_reviews.text: The output of this heater is fantastic, heats up my garage in no time! Even down to below freezing, I can walk out in my garage with a t-shirt and my garage door isn't insulated. The only gripe I have about this unit is the "off" switch doesn't work. I can turn it down and in to the off position but it still kicks on. I have to unplug it to turn it completely off. Really great heater overall!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Brown

customer_reviews.title: I suspect final factory inspection didn't happen.
customer_reviews.text: Works great after my repair. As received, it sounded like a 747 and vibrated enough to move across the floor. The fan motor mounting bolts (two) were loose and the fan blades were bent. It took me ten minutes with two hand tools to remedy the problem. Not a big deal. I'll find out how durable it is this winter.
customer_reviews.author: moto949

customer_reviews.title: Good heater for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater to put in my 7 x 24‘ snowmobile trailer to melt off the snow after every ride and to dry the floor it works perfect even at single-digit temperatures outside it’s very warm inside Keeps melting snow off sled in cold temps.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: check electrical plug before buying
customer_reviews.text: appeared just as the picture but since out outlet wasn't fitting with the plug we had to send it back. If we had an electrician come out to switch out the outlet to allow that wattage it would of turned this $100 buy into a $400 so we sent it back & settled for something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Deebee03

customer_reviews.title: Awesome heater!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12' x 24' lofted wood Derksen Building that's fully insulted with R13 except the floor. This little heater, does a great job keeping my shop warm. Right now the temperature outside is 8 degrees and I'm on the computer in shorts and it's warm and cozy. The fan throws air the entire length of the building and the temperature control turns it off and on to maintain it however you want. The air is not dry and the heater shell does not get hot, that infrared is awesome! Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Heats my 3 car garage well
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a few times, but each time I turn it on, my 3 car garage is pretty warm within 30 minutes, sometimes sooner. Only drawback is it doesn't have an OFF button, so I've had to unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hollon

customer_reviews.title: It does a good job and makes a difference when working in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I hope it holds up for a long time but given other peoples experience it might not. It does a good job and makes a difference when working in a cold garage. Like others have complained the fan makes a tin can rattle noise that can get annoying. The fan they use moves alot of air but is not a nice fan. Its a cheap sloppy design.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: No ON/OFF switch
customer_reviews.text: The heater actually works well. The problem is that there is no way of turning it off. The dial is just a thermostat control and does not go to an off position. This is my 2nd one. I returned the 1st one thinking that there was something wrong with the switch. If you buy it just be prepared to pull the massive 220V plug to shut it off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Costanzo

customer_reviews.title: Good little heater.
customer_reviews.text: This thing puts out some heat. I get my workshop up to temp with a bullet heater and turn this thing on auto and it will maintain an operable temperature as long as I want to work. I had to replace the inadequate wiring because it melted after 48 hrs of use but still worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: TROY WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for me.
customer_reviews.text: Warms up the 2 1/2 car garage just fine. It makes winter garage chores more pleasant. The unit itself never really gets hot. It just blows out enough air to keep it cool and you warm. If it is really cold I start it an hour or so before I plan on working in the garage. The air coming out of it is pleasantly warm but not too hot even right in front of it. I just plug it in to an adapter cord that plugs into the welders 220 outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our garage.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these to assist in heating a garage, they worked great for it.
customer_reviews.author: JRG

customer_reviews.title: This heater is the best you can buy for a 100 dollars
customer_reviews.text: This heater is the best you can buy for a 100 dollars. I had several 110 heaters running and running trying to keep my house heated, This one did so good at heating that I bought one more I know it says not for home use but I heat a whole house with just two of these things. They cycle off and on and I just treat them with caution just like you would any other heater. I use 220 window units so the plugs were already wired. I am not telling you to use them in side nor am I persuading any one to. Just letting you know what I use them for. Great heaters.
customer_reviews.author: KEITH

customer_reviews.title: Works real good
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for my personal shop that's 1400 sq ft. I put one on both sides. It takes about 20 minutes to warm the shop on a cold day. Just remember it is electric and it likes power. It small size is nice. I put them on a chef about 7 feet off the ground and used them about 12 1/2 months so far and no problems. It does take 220V line. If you turn it all the to off. The light stay's on but the heater seems to stay off even on 23 degree night.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little heater -- Really gets the shop warm in ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little heater -- Really gets the shop warm in short order -- I live in Montana and winters are cold here , but this guy puts out the heat and has been working away for 4 years now. How good is that. It is noisy but heats the place up really fast and the thermostat control works great. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney D Wood

customer_reviews.title: flimsy fan too noisy
customer_reviews.text: fan is extremely noisy! I have 2 heaters that look identical from northern tool that are 4 years old that run much quieter. also, the thermostat does not cycle as accurate as my northern tool fans. we will see how long the life cycle is since it is too late to return given the 30 day return policy.
customer_reviews.author: RudiGee

customer_reviews.title: Returned, my error
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. My 220 electric was not rated high enough for it. My error
customer_reviews.author: bmf143

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this product very much as of yet. I did set it up and tested it out and it seems to heat a small area quickly and I expect that the surrounding area will be heated up in a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Picky

customer_reviews.title: but the noisy rattle was way to annoying to use this in my workshop - most rattles ...
customer_reviews.text: The heater had a loud metallic rattle when turned on. I tried sitting it on different surfaces to make sure the rattle was internal to the heater and it was. The fan, thermostat and heating elements all worked for the short time I left it on, but the noisy rattle was way to annoying to use this in my workshop - most rattles tend to get worse with time. Also, be aware that the heater has a clearly displayed label on top it that says "for undustrial use only, not for residental use." Kind of strange - there is nothing in DR's product description on Amazon that indicates the heater is not suitable for residential used. I returned the heater.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cole

customer_reviews.title: left it on pretty much 24/ 7 this winter
customer_reviews.text: left it on pretty much 24/ 7 this winter, had it sitting out in the rain for like a week, still works without issues. I'm in a portable garage outside with snow on the ground in a t-shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Choose a different heater
customer_reviews.text: The fan had a load rattle to it and the heating element went out after a year and a half. It was for my garage so it was rarely used so it shouldn't have burnt out that quick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Heating 600 sq ft garage in Las Vegas. This evening it's 31 degrees out side the heater just turned off at 71. The garage is insulated but the door is not. It is a little noisey but you get used to it. Turn the TV up!
customer_reviews.author: arden keefer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This puppy really puts out the heat. Excellent for our need of keeping the interior of the house warm while finishing construction.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Breckon

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: After one season the fan just stopped working. Now It is a toral waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Firechachi

customer_reviews.title: This thing caught FIRE. BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: This heater caught fire today. After heating my house under construction for a month, I turned it on today and it caught fire. Luckily, I was rite there to turn it off immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best value heater!!
customer_reviews.text: Best value heater!! We love this heater. It works perfectly for getting a little heat in our basement, when we decide to spend time down there. Would totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: david boll

customer_reviews.title: The best small heater I've used on construction site
customer_reviews.text: Use on enclosed unheated construction site. It works amazingly. Room size is 16' x 40' and it keeps it very comfortable. Been running 24/7 for 3 months now without an issue. Will buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: I don't mind working in the garage during winter anymore!
customer_reviews.text: My 2-car garage stays like 50F during winter since it's insulated well, but after having the doors open and pulling a car in, it's a bit colder and this is real nice to get back to working in a t-shirt. My friend's garage isn't insulated, and I always bring this over if working there in winter. I cut the plug off and put a normal welder 6-50P plug on it to use in the welder outlets in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: heat in the winter
customer_reviews.text: If you have a garage that stores two cars it’s perfect it warms up the place real nice
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: It heats a double garage workshop nicely, raising the temperature to a comfortable 65 degrees ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I've used the heater during the month of November in Minnesota with temperatures around 25-40 degrees. It heats a double garage workshop nicely, raising the temperature to a comfortable 65 degrees in 10-15 mins. The fan is not noisy and the thermostat works well to maintain a fairly constant temperature. We'll see how well it does when winter gets serious, but so far I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B. Deason

customer_reviews.title: Its effective
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews said it was to loud. I didn't think so because its made for a shop or garage. a lot quieter than I thought. Also it heated up my 400 sf shop in less than 15 minutes. Which was very nice and maintained that warmth with the thermostat. Its made to sit on the floor but I have mine up on a small work table and the forced hot air fills the room.
customer_reviews.author: Randy H.

customer_reviews.title: Very good heater in freezing garage.
customer_reviews.text: Nice heater. I use it in my garage to heat the separated space that’s my workshop. It does a nice job.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Good Heater
customer_reviews.text: Not too sure what other reviewers are smoking. First this is a industrial type heater. It is noisy the fan moves alot of air. I am using this in a 1200 sq ft tilt slab building it WILL never heat it up but it really does take the edge off the cold. As to longevity only time will tell I am reasonably confident that it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: great heater lots of air flow
customer_reviews.text: So far it's great. Will see about durability although it's well built. Puts out a ton of heat. Of course you'll pay for it when the electric bill comes. 5600 watts is a lot. But it may still be cheaper than other heating methods especially if your just trying to temporarily heat a space for work. Cost me about a dollar an hour to run
customer_reviews.author: shooter mcgavin

customer_reviews.title: We love it. Keeps things nice and warm.
customer_reviews.text: We have a large shop turned down as low as it can go it keeps it toasty warm in there.
customer_reviews.author: E. Maddison

customer_reviews.title: It really works great and heats the garage to 70 degrees when outside ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this heater for my garage workshop. It really works great and heats the garage to 70 degrees when outside temps are in the 20's.
customer_reviews.author: InspectorK

customer_reviews.title: Quick Heat Source
customer_reviews.text: Had earlier versions of this heater & decided to go ahead with a new one. Latest model was a little nosier than in the past but heat output for such a little device is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: aqm

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: The heater worked great but it costs to much to run
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hayes

customer_reviews.title: works lerfectly.
customer_reviews.text: We have this in our 2 plus garage.we were not sure if there was a cord agtached to the unit or if it needed to be hardwired to electrical panel, but there is a 6 foot cord. Which allowed us to save money by not running extra 10-2 wire all the way to the unit.we hung it at the top of our garage ceiling in the corner and it moves the air really well. Great unit for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dellaj

customer_reviews.title: Thermostat temperature control , great
customer_reviews.text: Great , it warms a big garage in no time
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price with great heat
customer_reviews.text: Really excellent quality Great price Tons of heat output Used as temp heat for new construction apartments and kept them nice and warm for tile and joint compound
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product support.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product support. Heater does an excellent job. We have been using 2 heaters to warm a 2400 sq ft house during construction in Oregon. With 3/4 of full setting, the house, during cold spells, has been staying in the mid 60 degree range. More than adequate for our needs and impressive for only 2 heaters being used which cycle on and off due to it keeping the house at the desired temperature. I definately recommend the product. We'll use these to heat our 2000 sq foot garage next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Heater fan stopped working after 4 months heater shuts off because of thermal protector
customer_reviews.author: Aokhandyman

customer_reviews.title: This is just what my garage needed. It took ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just what my garage needed. It took forever for 120V units to heat up my workspace, and they ran constantly. This one gets the place very warm very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Screaming Dizbuster

customer_reviews.title: Good heat output. A bit noisey. A bit hard on the electric bill.
customer_reviews.text: Good auxiliary heat for my school space in the dead of winter. It uses a lot of electricity (5KW) but the efficiency is 100%. My primary heat is a heat-pump system with efficiencies up to 400% but dropping to 100% at outdoor temps below 20 F, and losing output capacity. I give only 4 stars because it's too noisey to keep on during class.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shunney

customer_reviews.title: The thermostat controls are easy to use and the heater appears to be well ...
customer_reviews.text: This heater really moves a lot of very warm air. The fan does make some noise but that is expected on a commercial heater designed for a workshop or garage not a home. The thermostat controls are easy to use and the heater appears to be well built.I would order again without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: Works great in my garage
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my garage, I just wish it had a on/off switch and I didn't have to plug it in to turn it on every time and unplug it to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great For Heating a Workshop/Garage
customer_reviews.text: Kept my garage nice and warm for working on cars and projects during the winter months of Northern Michigan. It does use a lot of energy while running so it wasn't used very often, but it made a huge difference when it was.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good heater. It gets a little noisey as it runs thru the winter months.
customer_reviews.author: SebastianI

customer_reviews.title: Your must be insulated for this to work
customer_reviews.text: This can get my shop to 72 degrees F on a 20 degree F day but I have insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great for the garage
customer_reviews.text: Great for the garage. Is it loud? Well, yeah if you put it inside. But in a garage, no. And you can stand in front of it and not feel like your skin is burning. It just feels nice. It will heat up a 3 car garage. Don't forget, it's 240 volts ac, not 120.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy N.

customer_reviews.title: It is 220v be ready to wire it up.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this one for a backup. I have one in my green house. This is the third year of use for it.(same model) It has worked flawlesly for me. When you start your plants In Febuary theres no room for error. I have had failure with other heaters. This is the only one I trust.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Stapleton

customer_reviews.title: DOESNT HEAT A LOT OF SPACE
customer_reviews.text: THE HEATER GOT TO ME WITH THE FAN LOOSE, IT DIDN'T WORK. HAD TO OPEN IT AND BOLT IT SO IT COULD START WORKING. IT BLOWS LITTLE HEAT NOT THAT MUCH AS IT SAYS, DOESNT HEAT UP TO 600 SQ FT.
customer_reviews.author: MARCOS RIVAS

customer_reviews.title: Great Heater
customer_reviews.text: I have had it hooked up for three weeks and so far so good. We have two car garage and it has been doing very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The heaters work well and keep the frost out. I have kept a 20 x 40 shop with 12' ceilings at 45 degrees easily once it was all warmed up to a stable temperature with one of these. They are a very good heater for temporary use. The only reason it gets 4 stars is they do drive up the electric bill but not a fault of the heaters performance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works really well! I kinda wish is had rubber feet but that's not what it would call a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: SalvageMan

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Works well and heats up a 400 squre foot garage. Nice quality too. Must have a 240v outlet for use and the cord is about 6' long to allow some repositioning if needed. Instructions warn that the unit should be used on the floor but I've had it on a workbench, away from the walls, with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Jamz Jr.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: using this to heat about 800 sq/ft cold concrete room. raises temp from 43 degrees to 55 in about 30 minutes. really moves air good.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic heater, moves plenty of air
customer_reviews.text: This heater can heat my insulated 2 car garage from 30 degrees F to 60 degrees F in about 2 hours. It does not get too hot to touch and it moves a good amount of air. It has a thermostat to maintain the desired temp. I would buy it again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sharples

customer_reviews.title: but placing it on the floor warmed my shop up nicely. Did take it about an hour of running
customer_reviews.text: I have a 24x24 shop with 10' to beam, didn't think it could warm it up, but placing it on the floor warmed my shop up nicely. Did take it about an hour of running, but so far works great. Definately is a noisey fan, but working in shop with radio and power tools, don't really notice anymore. Interesting to see how it does this winter when its single digits outside.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Heats up good and fast
customer_reviews.text: Needed A heater for a game room that was impossible to heat. All windows but this one works!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jolly Green Trees

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my father for the garage. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father for the garage. The garage is sealed really well and we thought this would do the trick, it did not. It raised the temperature a little bit, but did not kick out much heat.
customer_reviews.author: Jp2go

customer_reviews.title: fantastic deal!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Howdy!!! This heater really puts out the heat!!!! It will run you out of the house !!!! Just put on auto and full temp and you will be turning down in no time!!!!! A little loud for in a house but who cares when you have good heat!!!! The big 3 leg plug fit exact in the receptical I put in for my new giant 36,000 BTU Fredrick's AC wall unit I got off Amazon this summer!!!! This heater for the price is fabulous!!!!! Got to love Amazon!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JPrice

customer_reviews.title: I keep it at 50 degrees I am happy, so are the muscle cars too
customer_reviews.text: Working well in my garage floor ,I keep it at 50 degrees I am happy ,so are the muscle cars too.
customer_reviews.author: gerald bowne

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT, GREAT VALUE!
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT PRODUCT and a great value. Really does the job. Only drawback: weird connecting plug required me to have an electrician come in and re-wire the current outlet. A more common 220 volt plug would have made this unit perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dalgaard

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: Very good at heating my 3 car garage but VERY noisy as well.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, but works great.
customer_reviews.text: This heater works well keeping my 1200 square foot (insulated) shop warm. The fan is a little noisy sometimes, but for the price I can live with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, heats our big 2 car garage to over 80. and very easy to use and operate
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised heats our big 2 car garage to over 80. and very easy to use and operate the outside does not even get hot to the touch, just the front plate.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle e.

customer_reviews.title: Great heater.
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job heating my 12x16 shop which is not sealed or insulated. I like having the fan to circulate the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Bailey

customer_reviews.title: rattteeeelllll
customer_reviews.text: had to replace the fan it ratteled so loud got me evicted from the garage i was renting
customer_reviews.author: Chris Morris jr

customer_reviews.title: this is the little heater that can! Our garage ...
customer_reviews.text: this is the little heater that can! Our garage is fully insulated and surrounded by house on 2 sides and from above and this heater keeps the garage at whatever temperature I want!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

product_meta.title: Dr. Infrared Heater DR-988A Garage Shop 208/240V, 4800/5600W Heater with 6-30R Plug
product_meta.description: Color:RedThe DR988A industrial electric garage heater is perfect for warming any construction site, garage, basement, and workshop with its specially designed heating element and features an impressive portable design. It comes with a built in thermostat that can be adjusted from low to high. It also features a fan that provides continuous warmth. The DR988A industrial heater is dependable and sturdy.
feature_bullets: Comes with Thermostat control. Wattage: 5600W. Volts: 240V/ 208V
